description: From en- +‎ danger. Displaced native Old English frēcnian.

verbs.description: endanger (third-person singular simple present endangers, present participle endangering, simple past and past participle endangered)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To put (someone or something) in danger; to risk causing harm to.
examples: All the other difficulties of his reign only exercised without endangering him.

entries.meaning: (obsolete, transitive) To incur the hazard of; to risk; to run the risk of.
